Lambeth – West Norwood Library / Cinema joint plans.
Flintshire – Mancot Library to be volunteer run from Sept 2015, initially planned for five years
Herefordshire – Central Library may be turned unto "hub" for "Services for Independent Living"
Leicestershire – Glenhills now volunteer run (by 50 volunteers)
Hartlepool – £90k cut 2015/16: opening hours cut, room hire and other charges increase. Volunteer increase to be examined.
Leicestershire – Glenhills now volunteer run (by 50 volunteers)9
Cornwall – Library opens in Mullion pub, jointly funded by council and Pub Is The Hub.
Southwark – East Street Library will close and move to Thurlow Street in 2019.
Harrow – North Harrow Library to be volunteer run from October.
Harrow – North Harrow Library to be volunteer run from October.
Poole – Mobile library ends, replaced by volunteer libraries.
Shetland Islands – New mobile library starts.
Waltham Forest – Leytonstone Library reopens after £1.5m refurbishment.

Kirklees – 16 out of 24 libraries will pass to volunteers or close (previously 22 out of 24), 6 mobile libraries will also end. 88 full time roles to be lost, opening hours cut in surviving libraries.

Staffordshire – South Staffordshire and Shropshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust to take over Baswich, Brewood and Holmcroft libraries. Rising Brook Baptist Church will take over the running of Rising Brook Library.
Sutton – £1m out of £4.4m inc. loss of one library and one mobile, volunteers replacing staff, outsourcing or sharing services.
Cornwall – Consultation of future of Camborne Library: closure, volunteers or town council tax are proposals.
East Riding of Yorkshire – Consultation launches on cutting £3.89m budget.
Hampshire – 74 library staff take voluntary redundancy in £947k cut.

Herefordshire – Record Office (opened at cost of £8.1m in 2015)/Museum/Archives to receive nil staffing/support funding from council within three years. Consultant employed to see how this is possible (source: email received from Hereford Library User’s Group).
Lincolnshire – Volunteer run library will open at Heckington, with initial funding from county council, supported by town council. Resources taken from closed Coningsby Library.
Southampton – British Gas offers £25k to help volunteers take over libraries.
Cheshire West and Chester – Consultation on future delivery model of libraries/arts/museums/archaeology.
Cornwall – Launceston referendum votes 70% in favour of extra funding library via town council.
Enfield – Palmers Green Library reopens after £4.4m refurb.
Kirklees – Thornhill Lees and Lepton libraries to close in April 2016, all six mobiles to close.
Gwynedd – Porthmadog library to change location into leisure centre to save money and improve facilities.
Lewisham – £1m cut (from £4.2m) – Reduction to 4 libraries (Deptford Lounge, Lewisham and Downham Health, Catford) with 3 others ( Forest Hill, Torridon, and Manor House) becoming volunteer
Lincolnshire – Wragby Library likely to close due to lack of funding.
Kirklees – Thornhill Lees and Lepton libraries to close in April 2016, all six mobiles to close.
Newcastle – Newburn Library reopens after refurbishment.
